member.name: T:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions
member.summary: Collection of draw extension methods for the Silverlight WriteableBitmap class.
Collection of draw spline extension methods for the Silverlight WriteableBitmap class.
Collection of filter / convolution extension methods for the Silverlight WriteableBitmap class.
Collection of blit (copy) extension methods for the Silverlight WriteableBitmap class.
Collection of draw extension methods for the Silverlight WriteableBitmap class.
Collection of transformation extension methods for the Silverlight WriteableBitmap class.
Collection of draw extension methods for the Silverlight WriteableBitmap class.
Collection of interchange extension methods for the Silverlight WriteableBitmap class.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.Clear(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Fills the whole WriteableBitmap with a color.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.Clear(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap)
member.summary: Fills the whole WriteableBitmap with an empty color (0).

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.Clone(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap)
member.summary: Clones the specified WriteableBitmap.
member.returns: A copy of the WriteableBitmap.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.ForEach(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Func{System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Windows.Media.Color})
member.summary: Applies the given function to all the pixels of the bitmap in order to set their color.
member.param: The function to apply. With parameters x, y and a color as a result

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.ForEach(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Func{System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Windows.Media.Color,System.Windows.Media.Color})
member.summary: Applies the given function to all the pixels of the bitmap in order to set their color.
member.param: The function to apply. With parameters x, y, source color and a color as a result

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.GetPixeli(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the color of the pixel at the x, y coordinate as integer. For best performance this method should not be used in iterative real-time scenarios. Implement the code directly inside a loop.
member.param: The x coordinate of the pixel.
The y coordinate of the pixel.
member.returns: The color of the pixel at x, y.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.GetPixel(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the color of the pixel at the x, y coordinate as a Color struct. For best performance this method should not be used in iterative real-time scenarios. Implement the code directly inside a loop.
member.param: The x coordinate of the pixel.
The y coordinate of the pixel.
member.returns: The color of the pixel at x, y as a Color struct.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.GetBrightness(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the brightness / luminance of the pixel at the x, y coordinate as byte.
member.param: The x coordinate of the pixel.
The y coordinate of the pixel.
member.returns: The brightness of the pixel at x, y.

The blue value of the color.

member.param: The alpha value of the color.

The green value of the color.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.DrawBezier(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Draws a cubic Beziér spline defined by start, end and two control points.
member.param: The x-coordinate of the start point.
The y-coordinate of the start point.
The x-coordinate of the 1st control point.
The y-coordinate of the 1st control point.
The x-coordinate of the 2nd control point.
The y-coordinate of the 2nd control point.
The x-coordinate of the end point.
The y-coordinate of the end point.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.DrawBezier(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a cubic Beziér spline defined by start, end and two control points.
member.param: The x-coordinate of the start point.
The y-coordinate of the start point.
The x-coordinate of the 1st control point.
The y-coordinate of the 1st control point.
The x-coordinate of the 2nd control point.
The y-coordinate of the 2nd control point.
The x-coordinate of the end point.
The y-coordinate of the end point.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.DrawBeziers(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32[],System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Draws a series of cubic Beziér splines each defined by start, end and two control points. The ending point of the previous curve is used as starting point for the next. Therfore the inital curve needs four points and the subsequent 3 (2 control and 1 end point).
member.param: The points for the curve in x and y pairs, therefore the array is interpreted as (x1, y1, cx1, cy1, cx2, cy2, x2, y2, cx3, cx4 ..., xn, yn).

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.DrawBeziers(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a series of cubic Beziér splines each defined by start, end and two control points. The ending point of the previous curve is used as starting point for the next. Therfore the inital curve needs four points and the subsequent 3 (2 control and 1 end point).
member.param: The points for the curve in x and y pairs, therefore the array is interpreted as (x1, y1, cx1, cy1, cx2, cy2, x2, y2, cx3, cx4 ..., xn, yn).

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.DrawCurveSegment(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a segment of a Cardinal spline (cubic) defined by four control points.
member.param: The x-coordinate of the 1st control point.
The y-coordinate of the 1st control point.
The x-coordinate of the 2nd control point.
The y-coordinate of the 2nd control point.
The x-coordinate of the 3rd control point.
The y-coordinate of the 3rd control point.
The x-coordinate of the 4th control point.
The y-coordinate of the 4th control point.
The tension of the curve defines the shape. Usually between 0 and 1. 0 would be a straight line.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.DrawCurve(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32[],System.Single,System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Draws a Cardinal spline (cubic) defined by a point collection. The cardinal spline passes through each point in the collection.
member.param: The points for the curve in x and y pairs, therefore the array is interpreted as (x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, x4, y4, x1, x2 ..., xn, yn).
The tension of the curve defines the shape. Usually between 0 and 1. 0 would be a straight line.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.DrawCurve(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32[],System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a Cardinal spline (cubic) defined by a point collection. The cardinal spline passes through each point in the collection.
member.param: The points for the curve in x and y pairs, therefore the array is interpreted as (x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, x4, y4, x1, x2 ..., xn, yn).
The tension of the curve defines the shape. Usually between 0 and 1. 0 would be a straight line.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.DrawCurveClosed(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32[],System.Single,System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Draws a closed Cardinal spline (cubic) defined by a point collection. The cardinal spline passes through each point in the collection.
member.param: The points for the curve in x and y pairs, therefore the array is interpreted as (x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, x4, y4, x1, x2 ..., xn, yn).
The tension of the curve defines the shape. Usually between 0 and 1. 0 would be a straight line.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.DrawCurveClosed(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32[],System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a closed Cardinal spline (cubic) defined by a point collection. The cardinal spline passes through each point in the collection.
member.param: The points for the curve in x and y pairs, therefore the array is interpreted as (x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, x4, y4, x1, x2 ..., xn, yn).
The tension of the curve defines the shape. Usually between 0 and 1. 0 would be a straight line.

member.returns: The new inverted WriteableBitmap.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.Blit(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Windows.Rect,System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Windows.Rect,System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.BlendMode)
member.summary: Copies (blits) the pixels from the WriteableBitmap source to the destination WriteableBitmap (this).
member.param: The rectangle that defines the destination region.
The rectangle that will be copied from the source to the destination.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.Blit(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Windows.Rect,System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Copies (blits) the pixels from the WriteableBitmap source to the destination WriteableBitmap (this).
member.param: The rectangle that defines the destination region.
The rectangle that will be copied from the source to the destination.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.Blit(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Windows.Point,System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Windows.Rect,System.Windows.Media.Color,System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.BlendMode)
member.summary: Copies (blits) the pixels from the WriteableBitmap source to the destination WriteableBitmap (this).
member.param: The destination position in the destination bitmap.
The rectangle that will be copied from the source to the destination.
If not Colors.White, will tint the source image. A partially transparent color and the image will be drawn partially transparent.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.Blit(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Windows.Rect,System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Windows.Rect,System.Windows.Media.Color,System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.BlendMode)
member.summary: Copies (blits) the pixels from the WriteableBitmap source to the destination WriteableBitmap (this).
member.param: The rectangle that defines the destination region.
The rectangle that will be copied from the source to the destination.

If not Colors.White, will tint the source image. A partially transparent color and the image will be drawn partially transparent. If the BlendMode is ColorKeying, this color will be used as color key to mask all pixels with this value out.

member.param: An array containing the pixels as int RGBA value.
The width of one scanline in the pixels array.

member.summary: Draws an anti-aliased line, using an optimized version of Gupta-Sproull algorithm From http://nokola.com/blog/post/2010/10/14/Anti-aliased-Lines-And-Optimizing-Code-for-Windows-Phone-7e28093First-Look.aspx The WriteableBitmap. The x-coordinate of the start point. The y-coordinate of the start point. The x-coordinate of the end point. The y-coordinate of the end point. The color for the line.

member.summary: Draws an anti-aliased line, using an optimized version of Gupta-Sproull algorithm From http://nokola.com/blog/post/2010/10/14/Anti-aliased-Lines-And-Optimizing-Code-for-Windows-Phone-7e28093First-Look.aspx The WriteableBitmap. The x-coordinate of the start point. The y-coordinate of the start point. The x-coordinate of the end point. The y-coordinate of the end point. The color for the line.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.DrawLineAa(System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws an anti-aliased line, using an optimized version of Gupta-Sproull algorithm From http://nokola.com/blog/post/2010/10/14/Anti-aliased-Lines-And-Optimizing-Code-for-Windows-Phone-7e28093First-Look.aspx An array containing the pixels as int RGBA value. The width of one scanline in the pixels array. The height of the bitmap. The x-coordinate of the start point. The y-coordinate of the start point. The x-coordinate of the end point. The y-coordinate of the end point. The color for the line.

The y-coordinate of the bounding rectangle's top side.
The x-coordinate of the bounding rectangle's right side.
The y-coordinate of the bounding rectangle's bottom side.

member.summary: A Fast Bresenham Type Algorithm For Drawing Ellipses http://homepage.smc.edu/kennedy_john/belipse.pdf x2 has to be greater than x1 and y2 has to be greater than y1.

The x-coordinate of the bounding rectangle's right side.
The y-coordinate of the bounding rectangle's bottom side.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.DrawEllipseCentered(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: A Fast Bresenham Type Algorithm For Drawing Ellipses http://homepage.smc.edu/kennedy_john/belipse.pdf Uses a different parameter representation than DrawEllipse().
member.param: The x-coordinate of the ellipses center.
The y-coordinate of the ellipses center.
The radius of the ellipse in x-direction.
The radius of the ellipse in y-direction.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.DrawEllipseCentered(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: A Fast Bresenham Type Algorithm For Drawing Ellipses http://homepage.smc.edu/kennedy_john/belipse.pdf Uses a different parameter representation than DrawEllipse().
member.param: The x-coordinate of the ellipses center.
The y-coordinate of the ellipses center.
The radius of the ellipse in x-direction.
The radius of the ellipse in y-direction.

member.param: if true: keep the size, false: adjust canvas to new size
member.returns: A new WriteableBitmap that is a rotated version of the input.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.ComputeBezierPoints(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a filled, cubic Beziér spline defined by start, end and two control points.
member.param: The x-coordinate of the start point.
The y-coordinate of the start point.
The x-coordinate of the 1st control point.
The y-coordinate of the 1st control point.
The x-coordinate of the 2nd control point.
The y-coordinate of the 2nd control point.
The x-coordinate of the end point.
The y-coordinate of the end point.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.FillBeziers(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32[],System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Draws a series of filled, cubic Beziér splines each defined by start, end and two control points. The ending point of the previous curve is used as starting point for the next. Therfore the inital curve needs four points and the subsequent 3 (2 control and 1 end point).
member.param: The points for the curve in x and y pairs, therefore the array is interpreted as (x1, y1, cx1, cy1, cx2, cy2, x2, y2, cx3, cx4 ..., xn, yn).

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.FillBeziers(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a series of filled, cubic Beziér splines each defined by start, end and two control points. The ending point of the previous curve is used as starting point for the next. Therfore the inital curve needs four points and the subsequent 3 (2 control and 1 end point).
member.param: The points for the curve in x and y pairs, therefore the array is interpreted as (x1, y1, cx1, cy1, cx2, cy2, x2, y2, cx3, cx4 ..., xn, yn).

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.ComputeSegmentPoints(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the discrete segment points of a Cardinal spline (cubic) defined by four control points.
member.param: The x-coordinate of the 1st control point.
The y-coordinate of the 1st control point.
The x-coordinate of the 2nd control point.
The y-coordinate of the 2nd control point.
The x-coordinate of the 3rd control point.
The y-coordinate of the 3rd control point.
The x-coordinate of the 4th control point.
The y-coordinate of the 4th control point.
The tension of the curve defines the shape. Usually between 0 and 1. 0 would be a straight line.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.FillCurve(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32[],System.Single,System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Draws a filled Cardinal spline (cubic) defined by a point collection. The cardinal spline passes through each point in the collection.
member.param: The points for the curve in x and y pairs, therefore the array is interpreted as (x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, x4, y4, x1, x2 ..., xn, yn).
The tension of the curve defines the shape. Usually between 0 and 1. 0 would be a straight line.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.FillCurve(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32[],System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a filled Cardinal spline (cubic) defined by a point collection. The cardinal spline passes through each point in the collection.
member.param: The points for the curve in x and y pairs, therefore the array is interpreted as (x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, x4, y4, x1, x2 ..., xn, yn).
The tension of the curve defines the shape. Usually between 0 and 1. 0 would be a straight line.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.FillCurveClosed(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32[],System.Single,System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Draws a filled, closed Cardinal spline (cubic) defined by a point collection. The cardinal spline passes through each point in the collection.
member.param: The points for the curve in x and y pairs, therefore the array is interpreted as (x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, x4, y4, x1, x2 ..., xn, yn).
The tension of the curve defines the shape. Usually between 0 and 1. 0 would be a straight line.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.FillCurveClosed(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32[],System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a filled, closed Cardinal spline (cubic) defined by a point collection. The cardinal spline passes through each point in the collection.
member.param: The points for the curve in x and y pairs, therefore the array is interpreted as (x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, x4, y4, x1, x2 ..., xn, yn).
The tension of the curve defines the shape. Usually between 0 and 1. 0 would be a straight line.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.ToByteArray(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the Pixels from the WriteableBitmap into a ARGB byte array starting at a specific Pixels index.
member.param: The number of Pixels to copy.
member.returns: The color buffer as byte ARGB values.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.ToByteArray(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the Pixels from the WriteableBitmap into a ARGB byte array.
member.param: The number of pixels to copy.
member.returns: The color buffer as byte ARGB values.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.ToByteArray(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap)
member.summary: Copies all the Pixels from the WriteableBitmap into a ARGB byte array.
member.returns: The color buffer as byte ARGB values.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.FromByteArray(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies color information from an ARGB byte array into this WriteableBitmap starting at a specific buffer index.
member.param: The starting index in the buffer.
The number of bytes to copy from the buffer.
The color buffer as byte ARGB values.
member.returns: The WriteableBitmap that was passed as parameter.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.FromByteArray(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies color information from an ARGB byte array into this WriteableBitmap.
member.param: The number of bytes to copy from the buffer.
The color buffer as byte ARGB values.
member.returns: The WriteableBitmap that was passed as parameter.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.FromByteArray(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Copies all the color information from an ARGB byte array into this WriteableBitmap.
member.param: The color buffer as byte ARGB values.
member.returns: The WriteableBitmap that was passed as parameter.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.WriteTga(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Writes the WriteableBitmap as a TGA image to a stream. Used with permission from Nokola: http://nokola.com/blog/post/2010/01/21/Quick-and-Dirty-Output-of-WriteableBitmap-as-TGA-Image.aspx

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.FromResource(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.String)
member.summary: Loads an image from the applications resource file and fills this WriteableBitmap with it.
member.param: Only the relative path to the resource file. The assembly name is retrieved automatically.
member.returns: The WriteableBitmap that was passed as parameter.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.FromContent(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.String)
member.summary: Loads an image from the applications content and fills this WriteableBitmap with it.
member.param: Only the relative path to the content file.
member.returns: The WriteableBitmap that was passed as parameter.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.BlendMode
member.summary: The blending mode.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.BlendMode.Alpha
member.summary: Alpha blendiing uses the alpha channel to combine the source and destination.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.BlendMode.Additive
member.summary: Additive blending adds the colors of the source and the destination.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.BlendMode.Subtractive
member.summary: Subtractive blending subtracts the source color from the destination.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.BlendMode.Mask
member.summary: Uses the source color as a mask.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.BlendMode.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the source color with the destination color.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.BlendMode.ColorKeying
member.summary: Ignores the specified Color

member.name: F:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.BlendMode.None
member.summary: No blending just copies the pixels from the source.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.Interpolation
member.summary: The interpolation method.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.Interpolation.NearestNeighbor
member.summary: The nearest neighbor algorithm simply selects the color of the nearest pixel.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.Interpolation.Bilinear
member.summary: Linear interpolation in 2D using the average of 3 neighboring pixels.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.FlipMode
member.summary: The mode for flipping.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.FlipMode.Vertical
member.summary: Flips the image vertical (around the center of the y-axis).

member.name: F:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.FlipMode.Horizontal
member.summary: Flips the image horizontal (around the center of the x-axis).
